description.S1: Minister Clarke has a message for the Earth Directorate,
description.S2: and one of the only terminals in Halcyon capable of transmitting to the Earthbound message drone is in the Chairman's office.
description.S3: Go to the HHC building in Byzantium and send his message.

blurb.B1: If you've completed Balance Due you will have access to the HHC building and won't need to use the Maintenance Tunnels.
blurb.B2: You can also skip the tunnels by walking to the front door and bribing the guard for 2000 bits.
blurb.B3: Once inside the HHC building go straight ahead and talk to Guard Bachmayer.
blurb.B4: You'll take a lift heading to Percival Platt -
blurb.B5: he has nothing important to say so go left and unlock the door with Minister's HHC Access Card
blurb.B6: You can print the keycard at the terminal to gain the Ministry of Accuracy and Morale Key.
blurb.B7: You can also send Minister Clarke's message completing the Lying Earth quest and earning you a small amount of Negative Reputation with The Board.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: Please step away. This entry is for high-priority HHC business only.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: Are you here on HHC business?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Show him the minister's HHC access card.> Is this official enough for you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's through here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll be going now.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: Huh. I didn't realize we were still using those iridescent stickers. But this looks right.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll just need you to register your weapons with a Revised Request to Carry 32-B form. Each weapon will need a separate form.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Fine.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's ridiculous.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You'd better be joking.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: Now, let's see... damn it, when did I run out of forms?!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I can wait.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Oh, what a SHAME.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How about you save us both some trouble and let me through?

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, how nice for you! Do you have any idea how long it takes to request new forms? Or how many citations I'll get for "impeding HHC business" in the meantime?

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: Just know there are a bunch of guards upstairs, and they're all high on Dervish Mist and low on patience. So, try anything funny, and they'll paint the walls with your guts.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: You don't have to be sarcastic about it.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: Look, you don't have time to wait on new forms, and I can't afford the citations for impeding HHC business. So I'm gonna save us both some trouble and waive your forms.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: I was going to suggest that myself.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: Look, you don't have time to wait on new forms, and I can't afford the citations for impeding HHC business. So I'm gonna save us both some trouble and waive your forms.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Mighty fine of you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Roll your eyes.>

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Fine, but I suggested it first.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's procedure.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm not authorized to employ humor on the job, sir.

dialog.speaker: GuardBachmeyer (Male)
dialog.utterance: If you're not cleared to know, then I'm definitely not cleared to tell you.
